contents: Article 30 (Disqualifications for executives) ① Any person who falls under any of the following items cannot become an executive of the Sports Council. Revised 2019. 3. 13., 2020. 10. 13., 2022. 11. 11., 1. A person who is not a citizen of the Republic of Korea, 2. A person who falls under any of the provisions of Article 33 (Disqualification) of the National Public Officials Act Person 3. A person who commits a crime stipulated in Articles 355 and 356 of the Criminal Act in relation to his or her duties during the period of employment in a sports organization or city/city/county/county/district sports organization specified in items a through c of Article 2, Item 9 of the National Sports Promotion Act. A person who has been sentenced to a fine of 3 million won or more or a higher penalty and whose sentence has been confirmed (including persons whose sentence has lapsed); 4. Sports organizations specified in items a to c of subparagraph 9 of Article 2 of the National Sports Promotion Act; and A person who has committed a crime stipulated in Article 314 of the Criminal Act and Articles 47 and 48 of the National Sports Promotion Act by participating in match-fixing that affects the outcome of a game hosted or organized by a city/city/county/district sports organization shall be subject to a fine or greater. A person who has been sentenced and whose sentence has been confirmed (including a person whose sentence has lapsed), 4-2. A person who has committed a crime falling under any of the following items has been sentenced to imprisonment without prison labor or heavier punishment or medical treatment, and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed), or the date the execution is exempted, or the execution of the sentence of imprisonment or heavier punishment is completed. A person for whom 20 years have not passed since the date of receiving a suspended sentence or for whom 10 years have not passed since the date on which a fine was confirmed (including persons whose sentence has lapsed), a. Sexual violence crimes under Article 2 of the Special Act on the Punishment of Sexual Violence Crimes, etc. B. Sexual crimes against children and adolescents under Article 2, Paragraph 2 of the Act on Sexual Protection of Children and Adolescents, 4-3. A person who has committed the crime of injury or assault in Chapter 25 of Part 2 of the Criminal Act against an athlete is sentenced to imprisonment without prison labor or heavier punishment and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed) or the date on which the execution is exempted from imprisonment or imprisonment A person for whom 10 years have not passed since the date of suspension of execution of the above sentence (including a person whose sentence has lapsed); 5. Sports organizations and city/city/county/county districts specified in items a to c of subparagraph 9 of Article 2 of the National Sports Promotion Act. The following persons in sports organizations: a. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action higher than suspension of qualifications for sexual misconduct, such as violence or sexual assault. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action of more than one year of suspension for match-fixing, biased decisions, embezzlement, or breach of trust. Excluding those who fall under items (a) and (b), a person who has received disciplinary action of suspension or higher and whose period has not yet expired. 6. National Assembly member, head of local government, local council member, 7. Sports association board of directors is a member organization (member sport organization, member city) · A person who was an executive of the relevant member organization at the time of designation of the Provincial Sports Association as a management organization, and no more than 5 years have passed since the date of designation (including a person who was an executive up to 6 months prior to the date of designation); ② A relative of the president (pursuant to Article 777 of the Civil Act) (referring to a relative) cannot become an executive officer., ③ If an executive falls under paragraphs 1 and 2 or is found to have fallen under the category at the time of appointment, he or she shall naturally resign from office.
